intro: Gnaphalium purpureum var. spicatum, commonly known as the purple cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has a low-growing habit with slender, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. The species is known for its aromatic foliage and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia.
